result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelvin D Clemons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs AFTER 15 months.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by your agent. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not previously done so. 
All medications from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor pharmacy and prescriptions.

timeConds.notes:
First half must be served in jail. 
Second half can be on electronic monitor if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kelvin D Clemons in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Kelvin D Clemons in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:40 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Probation agent Jill Hytry is present. 
Counsel have received the Record Review but the Court has not. 
Court obtains a copy from Ms. Hytry at this time and reviews it at this time. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions parties re: defendants in custody status. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
4 years prison with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision - STAYED - 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs AFTER 15 months.
Placed on probation for a period of 30 months:
Serve 9 months in jail.
First half must be in jail.  
Second half can be on electronic monitor if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration. 
4 days credit. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by your agent. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not previously done so. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medications from 1 pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor pharmarcy and prescriptions. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Court advises post-conviction. 
Court questions Atty Hytry.  
Atty Hytry requests absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kelvin D Clemons in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:36 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1.  Count 2 will be dismissed and read in. State recommends an imposed/stayed prison sentence, 36 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, probation for 30 months, pay costs/surcharges, aoda and comply, no prescription drugs w/o valid prescription, sign releases, maintain full time empt, conditional jail sentence of up to one year.

State is not requesting a PSI. Court intends to order a record review and set matter for a sentencing date.
Atty McFarland has no objection to a record review.

Court addresses PSIs and Record Reviews. 
Court will not do a sentencing today.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Atty McFarland states that Defendant is a repeat offender.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a Record Review, to be completed by September 18th, copies will be forwarded to counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond will be ordered continued.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
